meanings.definition: Fail to hit, reach, or come into contact with.
meanings.sent1: The baseball player missed the ball during practice.
meanings.sent2: I missed the target with my dart throw.
meanings.sent3: She missed the bus, but luckily caught a ride with a friend.
meanings.sent4: His arrow missed the bullseye by just a few inches.
meanings.sent5: The detective missed the crucial clue that was right in front of him.

meanings.definition: Fail to attend, participate in, or watch.
meanings.sent1: I missed the school assembly because I was sick.
meanings.sent2: She missed the concert due to a scheduling conflict.
meanings.sent3: He missed the movie, but heard all about it from his friends.
meanings.sent4: The team captain missed the game due to an injury.
meanings.sent5: The student missed the lecture and had to catch up on the material later.

meanings.definition: Feel regret or sadness at no longer being able to enjoy or spend time with.
meanings.sent1: I missed my childhood friends after moving to a new town.
meanings.sent2: She missed her favorite TV show because of work.
meanings.sent3: He missed his old job, even though the new one paid better.
meanings.sent4: The retiree missed the routine of going to work every day.
meanings.sent5: The traveler missed home while exploring new places.
